page.title: 02HISTORY OF GLENROTHES
page.content: IN 1948 WORK BEGAN ON THE BUILDING OF GLENROTHES. THE FOUNDATIONS FOR THE TOWN WERE THE TINY VILLAGES OF WOODSIDE AND CADHAM WHICH WERE MAINLY RELATED TO THE PAPER INDUSTRY AND WHICH IN TOTAL CONTAINED A POPULATION OF MERELY 1000. THE ORIGINAL INTENTION FOR GLENROTHES WAS TO HOUSE MINERS AND THEIR FAMILIES ,BRINGING THE POPULATION UP TO 30,000 WITH THE MAJORITY BEING HOUSED IN A PRECINCT OF AROUND 1150 HOUSES WITH A POPULATION OF APPROX. 4000-5000. IT WAS INTENDED FOR THIS AREA TO HAVE A PRIMARY SCHOOL, A SMALL SHOP, A CHURCH AND A MEETING HALL. IF THE POPULATION EXCEEDED WHAT WAS EXPECTED IT COULD BE EXPANDED TO 35,000. AS WELL AS THE MINING INDUSTRY IT WAS INTENDED THAT GLENROTHES SHOULD HAVE A WIDE RANGE OF INDUSTRY SO THE QUEENSWAY AND WAROUT AREAS WERE......(CONT.)
